intro: Aizodraba trichocarpa, commonly known as the hairy leaf aizoid, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
